citation.article-title: Asticcacaulis benevestitus sp. nov., a psychrotolerant, dimorphic, prosthecate bacterium from tundra wetland soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Asticcacaulis benevestitus sp. nov.
Asticcacaulis benevestitus (be.ne.vesti′tus. L. adv. bene well; L. part. adj. vestitus clothed/clad; N.L. masc. part. adj. benevestitus well clad).
Cells are rod-shaped, Gram-negative, 0.5–0.7 by 1.4–2.0 μm.
Undergoes a dimorphic life cycle during which a sessile cell with one excentral, subpolar prostheca divides to give rise to a motile cell with a single, polar flagellum.
A single, non-adhesive prostheca 0.10–0.15 μm in diameter arises from a subpolar site.
At temperatures below 10 °C most prosthecate cells are embedded in a conical bell-shaped sheath, which is attached to the cell at the point of juncture of prostheca and cell.
Colonies are opaque, white, smooth, circular, convex with an entire edge, and 1–2.5 mm in diameter after 7 days growth at 20 °C on PYG medium.
Carbon sources include glucose, sucrose, xylose, maltose, galactose, arabinose, lactose, fructose, ethanol, acetate, malate, fumarate, succinate, raffinose, rhamnose and trehalose.
Yeast extract is required for growth.
Temperature range for growth is 4–28 °C (optimum at 15–20 °C).
Growth occurs between pH 4.5 and 8.3, with an optimum at pH 5.6–6.0.
NaCl is not required for growth and is tolerated up to a concentration of 2.0 % (w/v).
Susceptible to antibiotics that inhibit prokaryotic protein synthesis.
The major fatty acid is 18 : 1ω7c and the major phospholipids are phosphatidylglycerols.
The DNA G+C content is 60.4 mol%.
The type strain, Z-0023T (=DSM 16100T=ATCC BAA-896T), was isolated from a tundra wetland in the Vorkuta region, northern Russia.
